name: Soilpro NZ
description: Miles at Soilpro generously supports our school garden projects with biochar donated from his Pukekhoe base.

name: Birchville Community Garden
description: Fruit trees planted in Birchville Community garden’s new orchard were each given a helping of seaweed-soaked biochar. The garden team is using biochar as part of their efforts to regenerate the soil, and conserve water during dry months.

name: Clyma Community Garden
description: Managed by volunteers, Clyma Park Community Garden is a productive food growing space using our biochar in its composting systems.

name: Mahinga Kai Community Garden
description: The garden team at Mahinga Kai received the very first batch of biochar donated by The Good Carbon Farm. The team is observing how biochar changes the biology of their compost and growing beds.

name: Tawai Park Community Garden
description: Managed by volunteers, Tawai Park Community Garden is a food growing space using our biochar in its composting systems.

name: Rimutaka Baptist Church Community Garden
description: Managed by volunteers, Rimutaka Baptist Church Community Garden is using our biochar in its composting systems.

name: KaiCycle
description: KaiCycle is on a mission to see communities recycling their food waste and growing nutrient-dense food. Our biochar has been gifted to KaiCycle to incorporate into their gardens.

name: Fergusson Intermediate School
description: The māra kai crew at Fergusson Intermediate School is using our biochar in their school garden beds.

name: Tolaga Bay Inn Charitable Trust
description: Devastated by the impacts of Cyclone Gabrielle on their community, the Tolaga Bay Inn Charitable Trust initiated the Slash for Cash project. Led by the Māori community, the project repurposes forestry debris, regenerates productive farmland, and trains and employs a team of carbon farmers.

name: Southland Carbon
description: Andrew and Toula at Southland Carbon produce commercial quantities of biochar at a former brick and tile factory. Southland Carbon support our work in the South Island.

name: NZ Biochar Limited
description: Dennis at NZ Biochar Limited has expertise in soil health, organics, and biochar. Dennis is liaising with Enviroschools in the Otago region to introduce biochar into school gardens.

name: The Good Carbon Farm
description: The Good Carbon Farm is working across New Zealand to make climate impact tangible. We store carbon in community spaces by converting plant waste into biochar.

name: HM.
description: HM. is a globally recognised creative agency. The HM team works with us to create and build our brand and communications.

name: Massey University
description: Students from Massey University's Bachelor of Communication programme work with us during semester-long internships.

name: Victoria University Wellington
description: Masters students from Victoria University work with us to complete industry-based projects that enhance our work.

name: Biochar Network New Zealand
description: Biochar Network New Zealand connects and supports the biochar community, and advocates for the recognition of biochar as a climate mitigation tool.

name: Earth Sea Sky
description: Earth Sea Sky make sustainably designed outdoor performance clothing. Our team wears Earth Sea Sky clothing.

name: EnviroSchools
description: Enviroschools is an environmental action based programme empowering young people to design and lead sustainability projects in their schools and communities. We are working with Otago and Wellington-based Enviroschools to introduce biochar into their food growing gardens.

name: Upper Hutt City Council
description: Upper Hutt City Council has supported our work - including the development of The Good Carbon Store - via the Sustainability Stimulus Grant fund.

name: Simplicity Foundation
description: Funding from Simplicity Foundation has suppuorted the development of The Good Friend network.

name: Oke
description: Oke empowers children and communities by building food growing gardens in schools. Oke school gardens are using our biochar to incorporate into their food growing beds. Oke has built gardens in over 50 schools across the Auckland region.

name: Restoring Takarunga Hauraki
description: Restoring Takarunga Hauraki is a community-led ecological and outdoor learning programme in the Devonport Peninsula. Restoring Takarunga Hauraki is using our biochar in their indigenous plant raising nurseries to enhance tree growth, and save water.

name: Robert Mignault
description: Robert is converting forestry slash from his Auckland property into biochar.

name: Gallops Ridge
description: Matt and Debbie at Gallops Ridge are converting forestry slash on the property into biochar.

name: Slow Farm
description: Phil at Slow Farm has expertise in regenerative farming, and produces biochar from surplus green waste on his Fielding-based property.

name: Soilpro NZ
description: Miles at Soilpro generously supports our school garden projects with biochar donated from his Pukekhoe base. Miles has expertise in horticulture and soil health, and was using biochar miles before we had ever heard of it.

name: Mazda Foundation
description: The Mazda Foundation funded our 2024 project to provide biochar to projects based in the Auckland region.
